metadata.title: CVE-2024-38612 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:ipv6: sr: fix invalid unregister error pathThe error path of seg6_init() is wrong in case CONFIG_IPV6_SEG6_LWTUNNELis not defined. In that case if seg6_hmac_init() fails, thegenl_unregister_family() isn't called.This issue exist since commit 46738b1317e1 ("ipv6: sr: add option tocontrollwtunnel support"), and commit 5559cea2d5aa ("ipv6: sr: fix possibleuse-after-free and null-ptr-deref") replaced unregister_pernet_subsys()with genl_unregister_family() in this error path.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-38612` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-lowlatency - 4.4.0-2.16
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1094-kvm - 4.4.0-1004.9
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1129-aws - 4.4.0-1001.10
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro
